panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for POC Application
panel.preamble: Welcome to the ILS Automation installer for the LafargeHolcim POC Ignition Application. The table below compares the existing installation of this product, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined the "Lafarge" tag provider. This is required by the application.

panel.title: Custom Icons for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Custom icons are used extensively when drawing blocks in the Block Language Toolkit. They may also be found in many of the user screens.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs modules necessary for the POC application.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the application. The tag provider must be named "Lafarge".

panel.title: Install a New Main Project
panel.preamble: Lafarge is the main Ignition project. This page provides an artifact for a clean, new installation, completely replacing any existing project of the same name.

panel.title: Install SFC Charts in the Global Project
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of the SFC charts. These end up in the global project.

panel.title: Install SFC Charts in the Global Project
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of global scripting associated with SFC charts. These end up in the global project.

panel.title: Install test files
panel.preamble: This step copies test data into your user home directory. Look for Test.csv. Use it in conjunction with the DataPump.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of EMC Ignition Applications in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Ignition Applications - Installed
epilog.preamble: Now that all of the automated installation and configuration of the Exxon-Mobil Ignition Applications is complete, there are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Restart the Gateway first.
